alert.note: Alert for Pike (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Binghamton (South Central New York and Northeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 15 at 3:22PM EDT by NWS Binghamton
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Pike County through 400 PM EDT... At 320 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a thunderstorm near Paupack producing heavy rainfall, or 12 miles southeast of Honesdale. This storm was nearly stationary. HAZARD...Heavy rain and small stream flooding. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Small streams may come out of their banks and localized flooding is possible, especially in low lying areas. Locations impacted include... Blooming Grove, Paupack, Hawley, Pecks Pond, Kimbles and Lords Valley. This includes the following highway exits... Interstate 84 between 30 and 34. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...<30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Heavy rainfall is occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
